# What's new in .NET Framework

> Documentation for What's new in .NET Framework.

- [What's new in .NET Framework](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/whats-new/index.md): See what's new in various versions of .NET Framework. Read a summary of key new features and improvements in each version.
- [Obsolete members](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/whats-new/obsolete-members.md): See the list of type members that are obsolete in .NET Framework 4.5 and later versions. Members are grouped by assembly.
- [Obsolete Types in .NET Framework](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/whats-new/obsolete-types.md): See the list of types that are obsolete in .NET Framework 4.5 and .NET Framework 4.6, organized by assembly. Recommended alternatives are also listed.
- [What's new in accessibility in .NET Framework](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/whats-new/whats-new-in-accessibility.md): See what's new in .NET accessibility, starting with .NET Framework 4.7.1. Accessibility features let an app provide the right experience for Assistive Technology users.
- [What's obsolete in .NET Framework](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/whats-new/whats-obsolete.md): See how the .NET Framework class library marks members as obsolete. Understand the ObsoleteAttribute attribute, how to handle obsolete types and members, and more.
